page.title: 08Sorbie Creamery
page.content: Sorbie Creamery was built in 1891. The small{industry}produced very good Scottish{cheese}and butter.The nature of the area was also ideal because it included several {dairy farms}.Sorbie creamery was awarded the Scottish cheese graders trophy in 1960. 70 people are employed by the creamery.Up to 35 {tankers}collect and deliver milk to the creamery,from farms in Dumfries and Galloway. The milk is pasteurised for 15 seconds at a temperature of 161 degrees fahrenheit to kill off any organisms.It is then cooled and forms a solid substance,which is heated until it curdles,and becomes cheese. Salt is added to preserve it and to improve its flavour. The cheese is packed into blocks. The whey is spun -the cream for butter, with the liquid being sold to pig farmers.
